intro: Jatropha integerrima, commonly known as the roughleaf blistering plant, is a species of flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas and is characterized by its spiny stems and oval, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by toxic, orange-red berries. Jatropha integerrima contains toxic compounds such as phorbol esters, making it harmful to humans and animals. It is often found in disturbed habitats and is considered a weed in some areas.
